steps.title: Fold a dollar bill into a fan.
steps.content: Fold a dollar bill into a fan. Starting from one of the narrow ends, fold your bill like a fan or accordion using ½-inch (1.27-centimeter) folds. Do this for all of the bills that you have. [1] X Research source You will need about 30 to 35 bills. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Make some more fans using colored paper, if desired.
steps.content: Make some more fans using colored paper, if desired. Cut some colored paper down to the same size as your bills, about 2½ by 6 inches (6.35 by 15.24 centimeters) first. [3] X Research source Then, fold them into fans starting from the narrow edge. You will need about 30 to 35 pieces as well. [4] X Research source Add school spirit by using one or both of your school's colors. Cardstock or colored printer paper will give you a nicer look, but you can use construction paper if you have nothing else.

steps.title: Tape the edges of your fan together.
steps.content: Tape the edges of your fan together. Fold your fan in half, widthwise. Tape the two side edges together. When you are done, you should have a half-circle, fan shape. [5] X Research source Do this for all of the folded bills and colored pieces of paper. Set them aside when you are done.

steps.title: Cut a 4-foot (1.2-meter) long piece of ribbon.
steps.content: Cut a 4-foot (1.2-meter) long piece of ribbon. This will make the base of the lei. [6] X Research source The ribbon can be any color you want, but something that matches one of the school's colors would be ideal. Seal the ends of the ribbon with a flame. This will keep it from fraying. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Start taping the folded fans to the ribbon.
steps.content: Start taping the folded fans to the ribbon. Place the flat side of your first fan against the ribbon. Fold the two ends together over the ribbon, sandwiching it in between. You should now have something that looks like a disk. Tape the two ends of the paper together to secure the disk. [8] X Research source Start from the center of the ribbon and work your way outward.

steps.title: Continue taping the folded fans to the ribbon.
steps.content: Continue taping the folded fans to the ribbon. Alternate between money and paper. You can do money-paper-money, or money-money-paper. Stop when you have about 6 inches (15.24 centimeters) of ribbon left on each side.

steps.title: Tie the ends of the ribbon together.
steps.content: Tie the ends of the ribbon together. If you have enough ribbon left over, you can tie the ends into a bow. This is not completely necessary, but it will give the lei a nicer touch.

steps.title: Cut some cellophane about 6 inches (15.24 centimeters) wide.
steps.content: Cut some cellophane about 6 inches (15.24 centimeters) wide. You can use any color you want, even clear. You could also use one of the school's colors to get into the school spirit.

steps.title: Place a small candy bar on top of the cellophane.
steps.content: Place a small candy bar on top of the cellophane. Set the cellophane down on a flat surface. Place a small candy bar on top of it, about 3 inches (7.62 centimeters) from one of the narrow ends. Make sure that both are oriented horizontally. It's best if you use wrapped candies so that they don't melt. If the candies are very small, you could fit 3 to 4. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Wrap the cellophane around the candy bar.
steps.content: Wrap the cellophane around the candy bar. Starting from the long, top edge, roll the cellophane around the candy, forming a tube. If you need to, secure the cellophane with a piece of tape first. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tie a piece of curling ribbon to either side of the candy.
steps.content: Tie a piece of curling ribbon to either side of the candy. Cut two 6 to 8-inch (15.24 to 20.32-centimeter) long pieces of curling ribbon in one of the school's colors. Tie each ribbon to either side of the candy bar. [11] X Research source You can tie the ribbon into a bow or a simple double-knot. If you use a double-knot, consider curing the ribbon with scissors. [12] X Research source Use one of the school's colors for the ribbon, if possible.

steps.title: Tuck another candy bar into the tube.
steps.content: Tuck another candy bar into the tube. You will need to tuck, wrap, and adjust the cellophane around the candy bar. Tie another piece of ribbon right above the candy bar.

steps.title: Continue adding candies until you are close to the end of the cellophane.
steps.content: Continue adding candies until you are close to the end of the cellophane. Tie a piece of curling ribbon around the cellophane around each candy that you add. Consider alternating the ribbon colors for a more interesting lei. Be sure to match them to the school's colors!

steps.title: Make the lei longer, if necessary.
steps.content: Make the lei longer, if necessary. The standard 3-foot (0.91-yard) long piece of cellophane may not be long enough to make a lei. If yours is too short, cut another strip of cellophane, and tape it to the end of your lei. Continue adding candies and ribbons until the cellophane is filled. [13] X Research source Something around 4 feet (1.2 meters) would be ideal, so trim off any excess.

steps.title: Tie the ends together.
steps.content: Tie the ends together. When you are close to the end of the lei, tie a piece of ribbon around the cellophane, just above the last candy bar. Bring both ends of the lei together, and tie them into a secure, double-knot. [14] X Research source For an added touch, tie a piece of ribbon around the knot in a bow.
